name: store_memory
description:
Store important information in memory for future conversations. Use this tool to remember user preferences, goals, important context, and project-specific information. Only use for significant details that should persist across conversations - NOT for trivial or temporary information.

When to use:
- User explicitly states a preference (e.g., 'I prefer concise answers', 'Call me John')
- User shares important context about themselves or their goals
- Project-related insights that should be remembered (e.g., 'This project is for my thesis on AI')
- Key decisions or milestones in the project

When NOT to use:
- Temporary information that only matters for current conversation
- Information already available in sources
- Trivial details or greetings never pass user memory and project memory in together when using this tool, only one memory tyoe user or project at a time

user_memory.description: Important information about the user that should persist across all projects. Examples: name, preferences, communication style, general goals, expertise level. Leave empty if no user-level memory to store.

project_memory.description: Important information specific to this project. Examples: project goals, what the user is trying to achieve, key milestones, decisions made, progress notes. Leave empty if no project-level memory to store.

why_generated.description: Brief explanation of why this memory is being stored. Helps with future context and memory management.
